title: Request: numbered list icon
body: We have a super nice bullet-list icon, but would also be nice with a numbered one since you often have both options in rich text editors.

title: Request: Pipette icon
body: 1. 2. https://lucide.dev/icons/pipette

title: Request: Music Note Icon
body:
Would love an icon that has a music note and another one where it has a strike through it to indicate it is muted
Would be nice to have an icon for SFX and another for music

title: Request: Bug icon
body: Having a dedicated, native bug icon would be amazing :D

title: React icons jsx typescript issue
body:
Not sure how I would go about fixing this. Can anyone help out. Thanks!

title: Cursor does not change to pointer on hover over copy-to-clipboard icon
body:
When I hover over the copy-to-clipboard icon on the website, the cursor does not change to a pointer as expected. It remains as the default arrow cursor

body:
I added information regarding the [React Native version of Radix icons](https://github.com/Eronred/radix-ui-react-native-icons).

title: Request: YouTube Icon
body:
Hello,

Been using radix icons for a personal project and thought of requesting the YouTube icon here in case anyone also has the interest :)

title: Request: thumb up, thumb down
body: thumb up, thumb down

title: Request: Microphone icon
body:
Hello team,
Great project! :) I'd like to make a request for a microphone icon in the future.
Thanks

title: Request: funnel icon
body: Would be great to represent filters

title: Update Icon Following the Release of Twitter(X)'s Brand Toolkit
body:
With the release of Twitter's new Brand Toolkit, it is necessary to update our current icon to align with the latest guidelines. The Brand Toolkit includes important information about the visual and branding rules that we must adhere to.

You can find the new Brand Toolkit at the following link:
https://about.twitter.com/en/who-we-are/brand-toolkit

Please review the toolkit and make the necessary adjustments to icon.

title: Feature Suggestion: Radix Icons Site - On icon click, default to copy icon name instead of svg, or give options
body:
## What
- On icon click, default to copy icon name instead of svg, or give options

## Why
- I doubt designers or developers would be using the website to copy svgs regularly.
- Use case 1: Designers will likely use figma or sketch to get the icons in the correct frame size, etc
- Use case 2: UI developers would likely use the npm library, and icon names would make the most sense
- Use case 3: Self hosters would likely use a bulk import, using a zip containing all icons rather than one at a time.
- Use case 4: Users on other programs / use cases not as popular will likely require bulk import, and get the icons via the zip as well.

## Where
- https://icons.radix-ui.com/

title: Request: Sparkles Icon
body:
Hi, nowadays more and more apps are adding AI related features and I've noticed that most of them are represented by a sparkles icon.

It would be nice to have a sparkles icon in this set.

title: stroke width not calculated when passed as a prop to CheckIcon
body: I'm following the [checkbox example in the documentation](https://www.radix-ui.com/docs/primitives/components/checkbox) and added `strokeWeight` prop to ``. However, no matter what the value the weight doesn't change. I'm [looking at the code](https://github.com/radix-ui/icons/blob/master/packages/radix-icons/src/CheckIcon.tsx) and passing in the prop should work. I haven't tested this with other icons but I'm going to guess I'll see similar results. Meaning, no change. ``` ```

title: Canonical version numbering and release notes
body:
There doesn't seem to be a central log of release notes or verison number for radix icons, and what info does exist across various sources is wildly inconsistent.

body: could be a notebook, or a regular book -- something to indicate reading documentation

body: This will be useful for representing snap distances.

body: Would be nice to have a standard icon representing taxonomies such as tags or categories

title: chore(deps): bump dns-packet from 5.3.1 to 5.4.0
body:
Bumps [dns-packet](https://github.com/mafintosh/dns-packet) from 5.3.1 to 5.4.0.
Changelog

Sourced from dns-packet's changelog.

Version 5.4.0 - 2022-06-14

  • Feature: Added support for the SSHFP record type.

Version 5.2.0 - 2019-02-21

  • Feature: Added support for de/encoding certain OPT options.

Version 5.1.0 - 2019-01-22

  • Feature: Added support for the RP record type.

Version 5.0.0 - 2018-06-01

  • Breaking: Node.js 6.0.0 or greater is now required.
  • Feature: Added support for DNSSEC record types.

Version 4.1.0 - 2018-02-11

  • Feature: Added support for the MX record type.

Version 4.0.0 - 2018-02-04

  • Feature: Added streamEncode and streamDecode methods for encoding TCP packets.
  • Breaking: Changed the decoded value of TXT records to an array of Buffers. This is to accomodate DNS-SD records which rely on the individual strings record being separated.
  • Breaking: Renamed the flag_trunc and flag_auth to flag_tc and flag_aa to match the names of these in the dns standards.

Version 3.0.0 - 2018-01-12

  • Breaking: The class option has been changed from integer to string.

Version 2.0.0 - 2018-01-11

  • Breaking: Converted module to ES2015, now requires Node.js 4.0 or greater

Changelog

Sourced from json5's changelog.

v2.2.2 [code, diff]

  • Fix: Properties with the name __proto__ are added to objects and arrays. (#199) This also fixes a prototype pollution vulnerability reported by Jonathan Gregson! (#295).

v2.2.1 [code, diff]

  • Fix: Removed dependence on minimist to patch CVE-2021-44906. (#266)

v2.2.0 [code, diff]

  • New: Accurate and documented TypeScript declarations are now included. There is no need to install @types/json5. (#236, #244)

body:
Importing and using icons throws an error as you can see below

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55200060/199371737-457c3071-1ea7-4dc2-852f-52e11583637d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55200060/199372171-98b3586d-1658-4f30-8eef-db13f79266ca.png)


It's a `remix.js` project using `react 18.2.0` and `"@radix-ui/react-icons": "^1.1.1"`

It may be a problem with the bundling of the code

title: Add directory icons: outline, filled, open and closed
body:
Hi, I would like to contribute by adding **4 directory/folder icons**:

- Directory
- DirectoryFilled
- DirectoryOpen
- DirectoryOpenFilled

Following this [pull request (#96)](https://github.com/radix-ui/icons/pull/96#issue-1027167768) pattern. I copied the Figma file, added the 4 icons in the `Objects` category, exported the SVG, implemented the React components based on the other Icons and added it to the website.

This closes the following [Request: Folder / FolderFilled icon #84](https://github.com/radix-ui/icons/issues/84#issue-958482249)

---

PR checklist:

- [ ] Figma: icon shapes use “Scale” constraint
- [ ] Figma: icon components are sorted Z-A in the file
- [ ] Figma: icon components are built with a single union or compound shape when possible
- [ ] Figma: library changes are published
- [x] SVG: icons render correctly in a browser
- [x] SVG: icons are exported with `width="15" height="15" viewBox="0 0 15 15"`
- [x] SVG: no icons are exported with `stroke`
- [x] SVG: no icons are exported with `clip-path`
- [x] SVG: no icons exceed 5 KB
- [x] Website is up to date
- [ ] Sketch file is up to date
- [ ] IconJar file is up to date
  - [ ] Icon names in the IconJar library are correct
  - [ ] Version in the IconJar library description is correct

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/radix-ui/icons/network/alerts).
